intro: Urostigma costatum, commonly known as the zigzag or spotted bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has narrow, zigzagging leaves that give it its common name, and it often grows in rocky or dry habitats. Urostigma costatum is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
